intro: Cerasus vulgaris var. dulcis, commonly known as the sweet cherry, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Europe and western Asia. It produces small, oval leaves that are dark green and slightly hairy on the underside. The plant blooms with fragrant, white to pink flowers in early spring, which are followed by sweet, red or yellow fruits in summer. The fruits are typically 1–3 cm in diameter and have a sweet flavor with a slight tartness. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun for optimal growth and fruit production.
